intro: Phanera tianlinensis, commonly known as the Tianlin tree, is a species of flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
